alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 19 at 11:35AM MDT until March 23 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...A long durations winter storm is anticipated. Heavy snow is near certain. Total snow accumulations from Monday through Thursday will likely be 2 to 4 feet. This will be a long duration winter storm, and at times the snow will be quite heavy while at other times the snow will only be light to moderate. Southwest wind gusts to 30 to 50 mph are likely at times. * WHERE...Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Feet. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. If you will be traveling across the mountain passes, road closures will be possible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Dial 5 1 1 for the latest travel information.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft
